xxl.core.cursors.sources.io
Class ChannelCursor

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor
      xxl.core.cursors.sources.io.ChannelCursor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator, Cursor
public class ChannelCursor
extends AbstractCursor

This class provides a cursor backed on a channel, i.e., the cursor listens to the given channel and waits for objects send through it. When a certain termination object is received (for example null), the cursor stops listening and does not provide any more data.

After close is called, it should not happen, that the channel becomes filled from the other side, because the filling thread might become suspended.

Field Summary

          The communication channel that is used for receiving the data of this iteration.

Constructor Detail

ChannelCursor

public ChannelCursor(Channel channel,
                     Object termObject)
Creates a new channel-cursor that returns the data received through the given channel.

Parameters:
channel - the channel to which the channel-cursor is listening for its data.
termObject - the object that is used to signal the end of the iteration. When the channel is exhausted, i.e., no more data will be sent through it, this object will be passed to the channel-cursor via its channel.

ChannelCursor

public ChannelCursor(Channel channel)
Creates a new channel-cursor that returns the data received through the given channel. Until the channel-cursor receives a null object it listens to its channel.

Parameters:
channel - the channel to which the channel-cursor is listening for its data.
Method Detail

hasNextObject

protected boolean hasNextObject()
Returns true if the iteration has more elements. (In other words, returns true if next or peek would return an element rather than throwing an exception.)

Specified by:
hasNextObject in class AbstractCursor
Returns:
true if the channel-cursor has more elements.

nextObject

protected Object nextObject()
Returns the next element in the iteration. This element will be accessible by some of the channel-cursor's methods, e.g., update or remove, until a call to next or peek occurs. This is calling next or peek proceeds the iteration and therefore its previous element will not be accessible any more.

Specified by:
nextObject in class AbstractCursor
Returns:
the next element in the iteration.

close

public void close()
Closes the cursor. This method must retrieve all other elements from the channel, so that no other thread is waiting.

Specified by:
close in interface Cursor
Overrides:
close in class AbstractCursor

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
